verbose_text: Patients with sepsis who exhibit increased inflammatory factor TNF-alpha and IL-1 production exhibit a decrease in calcium influx, leading to systolic dysfunction in addition to direct damage to the myocardium by increasing IL-6 and IL-8 production; these changes result in systolic and diastolic dysfunction in patients with sepsis.
evidence: calcium influx, leading to systolic dysfunction in addition to direct damage to the myocardium by increasing IL-6 and IL-8
